definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: The invitation cards were written up daintily in white and gold.
sentences.chinese: 邀請卡是用非常漂亮的白字和金字寫成的。

sentences.english: Have you ever looked at the difference between reading white text on a black background and black text on a white background?
sentences.chinese: 你考慮過閱讀黑底白字和白底黑字的不同嗎？

sentences.english: But dreams are very rarely in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 但是用黑紙白字把夢想描繪出來是極難的。

sentences.english: I think it's a black sign with white lettering.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲它是一個寫着白字的黑色廣告牌。

sentences.english: Shen Ming when son, surnamed white Lotte.
sentences.chinese: 時有沉冥子，姓白字樂天。

sentences.english: Many users require specific high-contrast combinations, such as white text on a black background.
sentences.chinese: 許多用戶都需要特定的高對比度組合，如黑底白字。

sentences.english: Black-and-white banners proclaimed “welcome home” to “loyal souls.”
sentences.chinese: 黑底白字的標語是“歡迎回家”致以“忠誠的英魂”。

definition: frame (e.g. door frame)/casing/fig. framework/template/to circle (i.e. draw a circle around sth)/to frame/to restrict/Taiwan pr. [kuang1]
